definition: ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially

sentences.english: The black dog was there, too, but the small tin soldier looked straight at the pretty paper house and at the beautiful dancer.
sentences.chinese: 小锡士兵环顾四周，发现他又回到了同一户人家。

sentences.english: She looked round and saw )ett running.
sentences.chinese: 她环顾四周，看见杰夫正在奔跑。

sentences.english: When I standed up and looked around, just several people were still digging.
sentences.chinese: 当我站起来环顾四周时，只有几个人依然在挖蚌。

sentences.english: However, on a cloudy day, looking around, one can only see boundless land disappearing into a sea of clouds.
sentences.chinese: 但遇阴天时，环顾四周，苍茫大地，尽入云海。

sentences.english: When the sky is overcast, the horizon disappears into a sea of cloud.
sentences.chinese: 但与天阴时，环顾四周，苍茫大地，尽入云海。

sentences.english: When the sky is overcast, the horizon disappears into a sea of clouds.
sentences.chinese: 但遇天阴时，环顾四周，苍茫大地，尽入云海。

sentences.english: If you look around there, almost nobody is homeless.
sentences.chinese: 如果你环顾四周，几乎无人流浪。

sentences.english: Anderson lit the oil-lamp and looked round.
sentences.chinese: 安得森先生点亮油灯，环顾四周看了看。

sentences.english: PreSchool-Grade 1-Suzy Goose looks around and wishes she could be different.
sentences.chinese: 学龄前级1苏西鹅环顾四周，并希望她可以是不同的。

sentences.english: A prowler is someone that they’ve never seen before, looking around.
sentences.chinese: 环顾四周，小偷从未被别人看见。

sentences.english: But when he looked around, everyone else was studying the sand.
sentences.chinese: 可当他环顾四周，发现其他人都在研究沙子呢。

sentences.english: During the talk, Sandberg looked around the room and saw people nodding.
sentences.chinese: 讲演过程中，桑德伯格环顾四周看到人们纷纷点头。

sentences.english: It’s obvious when you look around that you’re not going to get all the resources you need.
sentences.chinese: 显然，当你环顾四周，你无法得到所有所需要的资源。

sentences.english: If you're an established writer considering self-publishing, look around.
sentences.chinese: 如果您是考虑设立作家自我出版，环顾四周。

sentences.english: Pull your head out of your rear, and look around with your own two eyes.
sentences.chinese: 昂起头来，用自己的眼睛环顾四周。

sentences.english: You have only to look around to see the prosperity of the district.
sentences.chinese: 你只要环顾四周，就可看到这个地区的繁荣。

definition: to run one's eyes over/to sweep one's eyes over
to size sb up/to look sb up and down/to take the measure of/to suppose/to reckon
to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
to raise one's head/to gain ground/account name, or space for writing the name on checks, bills etc
to look in all directions (idiom)/to glance around
to get up on hind legs (esp. of horse)/to stand/to spring up
glancing to left and right (idiom); to look all around
